body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky State Guard,
INSPECTOR GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, Ky., Janry 11. 1864
Sir

I am directed by his Excellency the Governor to request that at your earliest Convienence you furnish this this office with a Complete list of the absent sick from your Command stating, when it is known the whereabouts of each man.

As this is designed to enable the State authorities to look up and properly attend to our sick soldiers and have such returned to duty with their Regiments as May be found in Condition to do so, it is hoped that every Officer will lend us his prompt aid,

Very Respectfully
D. W. Lindsey
Insp General of Ky
Commanding Office
4th Ky Battery

Camp 5th Ky Battery
Point Isabelle Ky
Jan 17th 1864

Respectfully returned to Genl. Lindsay -- All of my absent sick, with one exception are, or were when last heard from, at the Genl. Hospital and Convalescent Camp at Camp Nelson Ky -- Their names are as follows -- Robert.C. Burritt Charles A. Carpenter -- James O'Brien, Jeremiah Herbert, Robert Hamner, Zachariah Vaughan, James Anderson, one the march from Camp Nelson to this place one man James Munroe, was left on the road sick -- near Halls Gap --

I am sir.
Very Respectfully
Your Obedient Servt
John J. Hawes
Capt. Comdg 5th Ky Battery

Point Isabell Ky
Jan. 17. 1864
Report of Absent sick of 5th Bat Ky Vol Art
Reported
Recd I. G. O. Jan 25. 1864
